 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לחַךְ‎</span> **verb** ==lick== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; so Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְחַךְ‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; - **Qal** ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּלְחֹךְ‎</span> [[Num.22.4|Num 22:4]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), followed by accusative; of ox licking up grass. **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִחֵ֑כָה‎</span> [[1Kgs.18.38|1Kgs 18:38]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְלַחֲכוּ‎</span> [[Num.22.4|Num 22:4]]; [[Mic.7.17|Mic 7:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְלַחֵ֑כוּ‎</span> [[Ps.72.9|Ps 72:9]]; [[Isa.43.23|Isa 43:23]] ***lick up*** (followed by accusative), fire from heaven the water in trench [[1Kgs.18.38|1Kgs 18:38]] of Israel consuming produce of land [[Num.22.3|Num 22:3]]([[BDB#E|E]]); especially <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָפָר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> ***lick the dust***, sign of humiliation [[Mic.7.17|Mic 7:17]]; [[Ps.72.9|Ps 72:9]]; [[Isa.49.23|Isa 49:23]].
